IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: CAP BELT IL A HWY/ SAINT BARNABAS RD

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
This incident was audibly and visually recorded. L-37 is equipped with MVR and BWC.
DWI # 23-232
D.L. # MD10274053342

CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING:
*I am trained to administer Standardized Field Sobriety Tests throughout the State of Maryland *Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. 
*Completed the Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement Training Course (ARIDE)
Vehicle in motion:
     On 07/31/2023 at approximately 0036 hours, I was dispatched to the Ramp from eastbound MD 414 to southbound I-495, Oxon Hill, Prince George's County Maryland for a single vehicle collision. Upon arrival, I observed a Blue Nissan Altima which appears to be abandoned in the grassy area of the shoulder. The aforementioned vehicle had severe all-around damage from the collision with the guardrail. The vehicle had Maryland registration of 9EM7194. Fire and EMS personnel arrived on the scene. The immediate area was checked for the vehicle occupants. Fire and EMS personnel were unable to locate a driver and cleared shortly after.
 
INITIAL CONTACT:
     At approximately 0136 hours, a female individual who matches the description of the registered owner arrived on the scene. I made contact, and she advised she was involved in the collision, and she is the owner of the aforementioned vehicle. She further advised she was driving the vehicle earlier.  
      I asked her why did she leave the scene of the accident and not contact the police. She advised she did not know why and was transported from the scene by an unknown male subject, who took her home. The driver was later identified through NCIC and MVA driving records as Gemma Lizeth Calderon, H/F, DOB 06/03/2002.
    While conversing with Ms. Calderon, I detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath and person. I asked Ms. Calderon where was she coming from and how much she had to drink. Ms. Calderon stated, "I'm coming from Oxon Hill and had 4 shots of Tequila Reposado.”
    Calderons’ eyes were glassy and bloodshot red. I asked Calderon if she had sustained any injuries as a result of the accident, Calderon advised her neck is hurting. Calderon agreed to be transported from the scene to MSP Forestville Barrack. She was met at the Barrack by EMS ambulance personnel. EMS cleared shortly after Calderon refused transport to the hospital. I requested Calderon to perform a series of Standardized Field Sobriety Tests at the Barrack, and she agreed. 

Standardized Field Sobriety Tests:

     The surface was dry and level. Before administering the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. I asked Calderon if she had any injuries that would preclude her from performing the tests. Ms. Calderon advised No, only her neck hurts. Ms. Calderon advised she is not on medication and does wear glasses.
 
HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6)

     The first test given was Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test. The tip of my pen was used as the test stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from her eyes. Ms. Calderon was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping her head still while following and focusing on the tip of the stimulus with her eyes. Ms. Calderons’ pupils were of equal size and showed equal tracking.
 
1) Lack of Smooth Pursuit: Present in both eyes
2) Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation- Present in both eyes
3) Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees- Present in both eyes
.
WALK AND TURN (2/8)

      Prior to Ms. Calderon performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be conducted. Ms. Calderon was instructed to place her right foot directly in front of her left foot and touch heel to toe on an imaginary line. Ms. Calderon was instructed and demonstrated to place her hands flat at her sides and to remain in that position until told to begin. Ms. Calderon was advised to take nine (9) steps in a straight-line touching heel to toe on every step. Ms. Calderon was instructed to keep her hands flat at her sides, keep her eyes focused on her feet, and to count every step aloud. On the ninth step, Ms. Calderon was explained and demonstrated to keep her lead foot on the line, and to take a series of small steps around with her rear foot to the left to turn completely around. 
     Ms. Calderon was again explained and demonstrated the second series of nine (9) steps were to be performed identical to the first series. Ms. Calderon was instructed that once she began the test that she was not to stop walking until the test was completed, keep her hands down by her sides, look down at her feet, and count each step out loud. I asked Ms. Calderon if she understood the test, and she stated yes.

INSTRUCTIONAL PHASE:
1) Nothing to report.

WALKING STAGE (1st Nine):
1) Missed touching heel to toe on steps 6 and 8 

2) Stepped off-line on steps 6 and 8.

Turn:
Performed satisfactorily. 

 WALKING STAGE (2nd Nine):
1) Missed touching heel to toe on steps 3 and 4 

2) Stepped off-line on steps 3 and 4.


ONE LEG STAND (0/4 clues observed)

      Prior to Ms. Calderon performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be conducted. She was instructed to stand with her feet together and hands down by her side while the instructions were given. During the test she was instructed not to begin the test until she was instructed to start once the test had been demonstrated. When instructed to start, she was to raise the foot of her choice off the ground approximately 6 inches. While her leg was raised she was to keep her leg straight, watch her raised foot, and to count out loud by thousands (one-thousand-one, one thousand-two) and to continue the test until told to stop. Ms. Calderon advised she has no questions and that she understood my instructions.

Nothing to report.


PRELIMINARY BREATH TEST:
The Preliminary Breath Test was not offered
 
ARREST/ INTOXIMETER TEST RESULTS:

     Based on test results, Ms. Calderon was placed under arrest for Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol at 0221 hours. At 0234 hours, Ms. Calderon was read the DR-15 Advice of Rights. Ms. Calderon agreed to an intoximeter test for alcohol. At 0256 hours the tests were administered by Sgt. Hooten #0001. The results were .11 Breath Alcohol Content. Ms. Calderon was issued the appropriate citations for DUI and released to her friend.

Case closed by arrest.
All the above events occurred in Prince George's County, Maryland.
